Name: Sazeroy
Ingredients: 5 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof /50% alc./vol.)
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
2 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: RINSE chilled glass with absinthe. STIR other ingredients with ice and strain into absinthe rinsed glass.
Review: A spiritious after dinner sipper which as the name suggests is reminiscent of a Sazerac.
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2015 by Giovanni Bruno at the Blue Bar at The Berkeley, London, England.
Nutrition: One serving of Sazeroy contains 167 calories
Garnish: Lemon zest twist (discarded) & maraschino cherry on stick
